author: Special Correspondent
text:
All Farmers’ Coordination Committee to organise the protest in front of Parliament on March 2

Various farmers’ organisations across the State are joining hands to form a human chain in front of Parliament on March 2 to highlight a slew of demands, including those related to the Cauvery, the Mullaperiyar, and debt waiver, according to president of the All Farmers’ Coordination Committee P.R. Pandian.

Addressing the media at Mannargudi in Tiruvarur district on Friday, Mr. Pandian said the human chain agitation would highlight important issues.

Major demands

Prominent among the issues raised were facing, including constituting the Cauvery Management Board and the Cauvery Water Regulation Committee, increasing the water level at Mullaperiyar Dam to 152 feet after providing CISF protection, waiver of all loans availed by farmers,

enacting legislation to prevent GAIL and ONGC from laying pipelines through farm lands and to get legal sanctity for jallikkattu.

Mr. Pandian recalled that the committee had met various leaders, including the President,

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and other important leaders despite several attempts the Prime Minister had refused to meet the committee.

“We fear whether Tamil Nadu was being denied its due in

issues concerning farmers,” he added.

“We farmers wanted to raise the issues ahead of the Assembly elections and that was why we have been forced to conduct the human chain programme before Parliament,” Mr. Pandian said.

“We hope all the elected representatives in Parliament representing the State would participate in the agitation.

“The agitation would last three hours,” he said.
title: Delta farmers to form human chain
